meanings.definition: To insert strips of fat into (meat) before cooking.
meanings.sent1: The chef was larding the roast with strips of fat to make it juicier.
meanings.sent2: She learned that larding the meat before roasting would enhance its flavor.
meanings.sent3: The cook joked that larding the turkey with extra fat would make it the star of the dinner table.
meanings.sent4: His storytelling was like larding a tale with suspenseful twists and turns.
meanings.sent5: The process of larding the meat was messy but necessary for a delicious outcome.
